thread.title: Lady Gaga Put On the Second-Most Viewed Halftime Show Ever
thread.title_full: Lady Gaga Put On the Second-Most Viewed Halftime Show Ever

title: Lady Gaga Put On the Second-Most Viewed Halftime Show Ever
text: Lady Gaga Put On the Second-Most Viewed Halftime Show Ever She slayed the show as well as the ratings. Share via Twitter Tom Pennington/Getty Images The ratings are in, and Lady Gaga's halftime show was officially the second most watched of all time. According to Deadline , 117.5 million people tuned in to watch the pop icon's 13-minute medley at Super Bowl LI on Sunday. The only halftime superstar to beat out Lady Gaga in previous ratings was Katy Perry, whose 2015 performance (alongside Left Shark) drew 120.7 million viewers. Take a moment to revel in the fact that the two most viewed halftime shows were put on by women. And Lady Gaga's ratings success does not stop there. As reported by Nielsen Music per ABC News , Gaga's music sales also went up due to her stunning performance. She sold 150,000 digital albums and songs on Sunday, while the day before, she only sold about 15,000â€”a staggering 1,000% increase. And on top of that, her song "Million Reasons" is currently number one on the charts, and "Born This Way" is in the number-two spot. Yasss, Gaga. The singer is parlaying her successful moment into other big news. Following her momentous performance, she announced a Joanne World Tour , sure to be filled with mic-drop moments. Gaga will also be performing at the Grammy Awards next weekend, and she will make an appearance as a judge on RuPaul's Drag Race . So, you could say the world is going gaga for Gaga. (Sorry.)
